column4: Does anyone know what causes this problem, http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=522223...
Hang on.
So you're saying it doesn't work right when you have a 6200 installed?
if i boot with my onboard card disabled and my 6200 it will hang during the boot screen
but if i boot with my onboard card, it will boot and then when X is loaded it will use my 6200
So let me understand this. If you leave the onboard set, it loads the onboard vid card then goes to the 6200 when X starts?
What is your primary display adapter set to in the BIOS?
Find the line in /etc/X11/xorg.conf that has your graphics card section that says Driver "..."
What does it say? nvidia?
yeah drivers nvidia
I wonder if you have some kind of hardware problem.
The fact that it hangs when it's set to the vid card in the BIOS indicates something is wrong.
windows boots fine
Odd. Do you bench and game fine in Winblows?
no, i bench and game fine in WinDOWs.
Rofl.
Hmm this is a tough one. I've never had that problem as I always set it to my AGP card with my systems.
its just weird that once X is up everythings fine, but ubuntu seems atached to my graphics card..
I wonder if the syslog would have anything. It might be conflicting or something.
I'm really stabbing into the dark now :(.
cat /var/log/syslog
Try setting the driver to nv from nvidia. You may have to do a sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf and edit that line I asked you to find earlier. See if that helps.

nope its just about network-manager, when i boot into recovery mode i get some errors, the ones which i wrote down ( c0103346) ( c02eec5c) (c0105350) (c0105362) work_notifysig+0x13/0x18 and error_code+0x7c/0xp0
